detected_integrations.description: Attendance module integrates with leave request creation and status management. Issues include inability to create leave requests from attendance reports, improper status synchronization for split shift leave requests, and lack of automatic table refresh after leave request creation.

Attendance records feed into payroll processing. Gaps include missing validation APIs for attendance records during payroll transitions, inability to block modifications to linked pay adjustment requests, and lack of attendance ON/OFF synchronization across payroll companies.

Attendance and Shift Scheduler modules are tightly coupled, preventing independent configuration. System lacks bulk import capabilities for shift schedules and monthly calendar views for scheduling oversight.
Work Center is tightly coupled with Attendance module, preventing granular permission control and independent configuration across HR system components.
Time-off module is tightly coupled with Attendance, affecting leave request workflows and preventing independent configuration of time-off policies.

Attendance module receives biometric data uploads. System lacks unique index constraints for mobile check-in/out records, potentially allowing duplicate entries. Performance optimization has been addressed through cache implementation.

Attendance module should trigger notifications for policy processes and weekly summaries. Currently lacks automated email notification system for weekly attendance summaries and push notifications about attendance policy processes.

Attendance system does not properly handle inactive or off-boarded employees. Issues include inability to prevent mentioning inactive employees in comments and lack of mechanisms to handle offboarded employee records created before offboarding feature implementation.
Attendance adjustment tickets flow through approval chains. Self-approval scenarios and pending status visibility gaps prevent workflow progression and record updates.
Face liveness detection for biometric attendance security depends on AWS Rekognition Flutter SDK, which is currently unavailable, blocking implementation.
Attendance overrides and hour modifications create compensatory time adjustments. System lacks visibility into these adjustments and cannot display pending adjustment counts in reports.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The attendance module has multiple frontend rendering and interaction issues that degrade user experience. Checkout details are not properly sorted chronologically, the attendance edit dialog's map component initialization causes JavaScript errors during rapid mouse interactions, and attendance tables do not automatically refresh after creating leave requests, requiring manual page reload.

The attendance reporting system lacks comprehensive customization and filtering capabilities. Administrators cannot create custom report tabs, apply advanced filters to control employee list visibility, and the system cannot properly handle status updates for split shift leave requests across multiple shift rows. Additionally, there is no automated email notification system for weekly attendance summaries.

The platform does not allow line managers to create leave requests directly from the Daily Attendance Report, requiring additional manual steps. Additionally, the system lacks built-in controls to prevent modifications to pay adjustment requests that are linked to attendance records, creating risks for unintended data changes affecting payroll accuracy.

The platform lacks robust mechanisms for handling attendance violations. The system has limited capabilities in automated tracking, escalation, and disciplinary process management. Additionally, administrators cannot configure a specific time period for taking action on attendance violations, limiting the platform's flexibility in time and attendance management.

The attendance system has multiple data integrity gaps. The platform lacks a unique index for mobile check-in/out records, potentially allowing duplicate employee time entries. The system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments, creating confusion and inappropriate interactions. Additionally, there is no automated validation mechanism for attendance records during payroll status transitions.

The attendance module has backend technical issues affecting stability and performance. The system has API version compatibility constraints that prevent editing employee attendance information. The attendance controller lacks robust null parameter validation, creating potential runtime exceptions during processing. Additionally, the attendance calculation backend has performance limitations in caching daily available actions, creating bottlenecks in attendance processing.

The platform has architectural limitations affecting configuration flexibility. The Attendance, Shift Scheduler, Work Center, and Time-off modules are tightly coupled, preventing independent configuration and management. The permission structure does not allow granular control across different HR system components. Additionally, the platform lacks a robust mechanism to handle employee offboarding for records created before the offboarding feature was introduced, creating data visibility challenges. The system also lacks a standardized API for managing attendance ON/OFF status across different payroll-related companies.

The attendance system lacks bulk data import and comprehensive calendar visualization capabilities. Users cannot import shift schedules in bulk from Excel or similar spreadsheet formats, restricting them to manual, individual shift entry. Additionally, the system lacks a robust monthly calendar view for scheduling and time tracking, limiting users' ability to get a comprehensive overview of attendance and scheduling patterns.

The platform currently lacks visibility of policy tabs for employees, which prevents meaningful push notifications about attendance policy processes. This structural limitation in the employee interface prevents the backend from sending targeted notifications related to attendance policy changes and updates.

When a ticket creator is also the final approver in the authorization chain, the ticket remains stuck in Pending status and the associated attendance record fails to update. This creates a system blockage preventing workflow progression.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Attendance Data Entry Timestamp & Concurrency Issues
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks robust timestamp validation during manual attendance record creation, resulting in incorrect date assignments and work hour computations. Additionally, concurrent edits to the same attendance entry cause race conditions and data inconsistency.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Status Prevents Attendance Check-In & Record Integrity
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system automatically removes attendance records when leave is approved, and prevents employees from checking in during half-day leave periods. This creates workflow restrictions that prevent accurate time tracking and flexible work logging during partial leave scenarios.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Attendance Reporting Lacks Filtering, Analytics & Visibility
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The attendance reporting system cannot filter or exclude specific employees from reports, lacks pending adjustment status visibility, provides no advanced analytics infrastructure, and displays facial recognition confidence columns incorrectly. This creates information opacity and rigid reporting mechanisms.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: User Experience Gaps in Error Handling & Navigation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system exposes raw technical error messages to users, lacks double-click prevention on critical actions like 'Remove From Payroll', and does not provide contextual guidance when employee office or scheduling information is incomplete. These gaps create confusion and potential unintended actions.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Biometric Security Implementation Blocked by SDK Gap
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: AWS Rekognition currently lacks a Flutter SDK for face liveness detection, creating a technical barrier that prevents implementation of comprehensive biometric security in the attendance module. Custom development is required to bridge this integration gap.

Administrators and line managers lack flexible mechanisms to edit and track daily attendance status changes. The system also lacks granular permission configuration capabilities, preventing precise access control setup for the Attendance module.

The platform lacks comprehensive overtime policy configuration that meets UAE Federal labor law requirements for different employee classifications and overtime rate calculations. Additionally, the system lacks bulk compensation assignment functionality, forcing manual processing of individual compensation entries.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Shift Display Inconsistency in Active Period Reporting
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has an intentional design constraint where active shifts (today/yesterday) are not displayed as consolidated blocks in attendance reports. This creates visual inconsistency in how shifts are represented across different time periods.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Active shifts are intentionally not consolidated to maintain a specific reporting structure

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The attendance initialization endpoint has transaction handling issues preventing reliable service communication and consistent configuration setup. The module also lacks comprehensive attendance tracking functionality for trust domain configurations and has multiple unaddressed capabilities around time tracking and shift management.
